Span.Span: Volume of organic searches of SAS branded terms over time. This is a measure of organic search volume across multiple browsers and not a measure of organic search traffic to SAS web properties.

P.Span: Updated monthly
See the
for additional detail and filtering options.

Social media mentions of SAS over time. SAS social media monitoring captures social posts mentioning SAS and key terms determined for relevancy. Key terms are adjusted periodically for improved relevancy, historical values may also update with these changes or other platform listening rules. Social platforms tracked include Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, Reddit and Quora.
Source: Sprinklr. Primary contact:
for additional detail.

Users to www.sas.com and high-value actions taken on global Curiosity Forever home pages. High-Value Actions are actions users take on Curiosity Forever pages that we use to track engagement with key content in our three brand categories of awareness, consideration, and intent and to optimize digital marketing efforts.
Source: Google Analytics Corporate Site (www.sas.com) view. Primary contact:
Curiosity Forever Web Dashboard
Annual global study on key brand health metrics and brand attributes.
Source: Illuminas. Primary contact:
Next update November 2021
Understand and measure the impact of SAS’ “Curiosity Forever” brand campaign messaging and creative on key brand health metrics.
Source: Qualtrics. Primary contact:
Next update July 2021.

Source: Marketing Sciences & Technology. Primary contact:

P.Span: Social media mentions of SAS in the context of key terms and brand attributes will be an indicator or raising awareness and creating energy for the SAS brand. Similar to branded search terms, Social Media conversations are a short-term KPI of the brand campaign, and we want to see an increase in SAS mentions overall and for identified terms specifically after the first 3-6 months.

P.Span: Unique visitors to www.sas.com and high-value actions taken on global Curiosity Forever home pages will be early indicators of the brand campaign creating awareness and engagement with relevant audiences. As early indicator (first 6-8 weeks) we are measuring the overall traffic lift to www.sas.com and the engagements the brand campaign is creating.
CURIOSITY FOREVER HIGH-VALUE ACTIONS

Span.Span: Actions users take on Curiosity Forever landing pages used to track engagement in our brand categories of awareness, consideration and intent.

P.Span: April insights
At the second week of each month we will share key observations and insights we see in the data, and any actions we are taking because of it.

Span.Span: Our brand is about connecting to who we are,
what we believe and the values that unify us.

P.Span: — Susan Ellis, SAS Brand Director

Our Brand campaign, Curiosity Forever, launched globally with broad emotional creative at the beginning of April. In the middle of May we are adding Industry-focused creative that starts connecting Curiosity to Capability. Aimed at shifting perceptions, a Brand campaign is a longer-term marketing initiative and will make an impact over time.
With this dashboard we provide insight into campaign performance through early indicators as well as short and long-term measures.
Annual brand study to assess the SAS brand health across key metrics. Two key metrics from the 2020 brand study are noted below. The next study will be available in November.

VisualElements.Graph:
false
INNOVATION PERCEPTION <StatGraph border="false" opaque="false" missingValueDisplay="autolabel"> <PadAttrs top="0px" bottom="0px" left="0px" right="0px"/> <Meta> <DynVars> <DynVar name="CATEGORY" description="CATEGORY_VAR" required="false" assignedType="character" type="character"> <DefaultValues> <Value>dd6677.bi6679</Value> </DefaultValues> </DynVar> <DynVar name="RESPONSE" description="MEASURE_VAR" required="true" assignedType="numeric" type="numeric"> <DefaultValues> <Value>dd6677.bi6680</Value> </DefaultValues> </DynVar> <DynVar name="TIP" description="TIP_VAR" required="false" assignedType="numeric" type="any" multiplesAllowed="true"> <DefaultValues> <Value>dd6677.bi6680</Value> </DefaultValues> </DynVar> <DynVar name="HIDDEN" description="HIDDEN_VAR" required="false" type="character" multiplesAllowed="true"/> </DynVars> </Meta> <LayoutRegion> <KeyValue name="KeyValue" tipListPolicy="replace" _stmt="keyValue" display="OUTLINE RESPONSEVALUE" hAlign="center" justify="left" key="responsevalue" vAlign="center" tip="TIP" category="CATEGORY" response="RESPONSE"> <KeyAttrs color="273481"/> <OutlineAttrs color="15823532"/> </KeyValue> </LayoutRegion> </StatGraph>

P.Span: The global brand study data identified Innovation Perception as key driver for being recommended for data & analytics investments.

VisualElements.Graph:
false
UNAIDED AWARENESS <StatGraph border="false" opaque="false" missingValueDisplay="autolabel"> <PadAttrs top="0px" bottom="0px" left="0px" right="0px"/> <Meta> <DynVars> <DynVar name="CATEGORY" description="CATEGORY_VAR" required="false" assignedType="character" type="character"> <DefaultValues> <Value>dd6692.bi6694</Value> </DefaultValues> </DynVar> <DynVar name="RESPONSE" description="MEASURE_VAR" required="true" assignedType="numeric" type="numeric"> <DefaultValues> <Value>dd6692.bi6695</Value> </DefaultValues> </DynVar> <DynVar name="TIP" description="TIP_VAR" required="false" assignedType="numeric" type="any" multiplesAllowed="true"> <DefaultValues> <Value>dd6692.bi6695</Value> </DefaultValues> </DynVar> <DynVar name="HIDDEN" description="HIDDEN_VAR" required="false" type="character" multiplesAllowed="true"/> </DynVars> </Meta> <LayoutRegion> <KeyValue name="KeyValue" tipListPolicy="replace" _stmt="keyValue" display="OUTLINE RESPONSEVALUE" hAlign="center" justify="left" key="responsevalue" vAlign="center" tip="TIP" category="CATEGORY" response="RESPONSE"> <KeyAttrs color="273481"/> <OutlineAttrs color="15823532"/> </KeyValue> </LayoutRegion> </StatGraph>

P.Span: Research shows that short lists are built with companies / brands that come to mind quickly. 'Unaided Awareness' tells us how much mental availability SAS occupies within our global audiences. When we increase this number, we increase our chances to make it onto shortlists.

Span.Span: Between June 2nd – 9th 2021 we surveyed 1,180 qualified respondents to learn how the B2H and B2D videos impact their view of SAS. Overall, the campaign is improving our Innovation perception and makes Technologists want to learn more about SAS.
had a favorable impression of SAS
increase in association of SAS “providing the most innovative solutions in DMA”
of respondents said they are likely to want to learn more
think “SAS is on its way up”
no significant increase for “likelihood to consider” and “likelihood to recommend”
wear-in of the campaign we'll start reporting the impact of the brand campaign on Marketing Influenced Pipeline.
We plan to start reporting out in the 2nd half of the year.

P.Span: Organic branded search volume is an indicator of creating broader awareness of and interest in SAS. The data is for the 20 countries we are focusing on. This being a short-term KPI of the brand campaign, we want to see an increase in SAS-branded search overall and by SAS + key terms after the first 3-6 months. Keep in mind that the term "SAS" has multiple meanings around the world, and not all are associated with our brand.
"SAS" + KEY TERMS

The first half of 2021 sees an overall drop in branded search volume compared to 2020. We believe this is due to Covid-19. Note that searches for 'SAS' include other organizations and companies shortened to 'SAS'. The spike of searches from January-May 2020 was mainly driven by Spain and searches for a Spanish government health organization. A drop in searches Jan-May of 2021 can be attributed to a 33% drop Year-over-year in searches for the airline 'SAS' in Norway and Sweden.
Social media mentions and news stories covering SAS and innovation have had the biggest impact so far on search volume. 'SAS Innovation' continues to grow in search volume month-over-month.

P.Span: Social media mentions of SAS in the context of key terms and brand attributes will be an indicator or raising awareness and creating energy for the SAS brand. Similar to branded search terms, Social Media conversations are a short-term KPI of the brand campaign, and we want to see an increase in SAS mentions overall and for identified terms specifically after the first 3-6 months.

P.Span: "SAS" + KEY TERMS

June 2021 overall SAS mentions were -27.7% from prior year and -77% from last month. This is expected because SAS Global Forum boosted comparisons for both June 2020 and May 2021. Post volumes are in the range of monthly average and a typical slowdown in the summer months.

Top post volume drivers were #SASGF, #SASchat and #SASVisionary. Posts for #SASGF and promotion through #SASVisionary influencers were top reach drivers, while #SASchat, #SASGF and #Curiosity Forever led engagement.
HBR sponsored posts on Twitter and Facebook led highest reach per post, top reach for Curiosity Forever campaign, as well as overall top engagement.
With regional social accounts starting their promotional activities, we see a dip in per post average engagements and clicks; we believe this is due to lower follower counts of regional accounts.
Across social platforms we see video posts generate the highest engagement, confirming our video-first strategy.

Comparing social platforms, Twitter boasts the most post volume and estimated reach, LinkedIn and Instagram drove nearly equal engagements. The top 3 posts by engagement were all Instagram B2D - Banking Solutions, Manufacturing, and predictive Healthcare.

P.Span: Unique visitors to www.sas.com and high-value actions taken on global Curiosity Forever home pages will be early indicators of the brand campaign creating awareness and engagement with relevant audiences. As early indicator (first 6-8 weeks) we are measuring the overall traffic lift to www.sas.com and the engagements the brand campaign is creating.
CURIOSITY FOREVER HIGH-VALUE ACTIONS
A High Value Action (HVA) is a click / view of Curiosity Forever content categorized against the marketing funnel. The data is used to optimize campaign content and build remarketing audiences.
June was the first full month for Brand to Demand English creative, with languages rolling out over the next few weeks. A few highlights:

The decrease in total campaign site visits MoM (~36% or 1 million visitors) is primarily due to toutiao.com campaign activity by the China team ending in May. In June we also see a slight increase in organic page visits of 2% which would be a positive sign that the campaign is starting to increase some mental availability and recall.

June also saw a broader roll out of B2D creative globally which has the goal to start driving direct engagement with SAS through the industry-sparks: exposure to and engagement with 'Consideration'-tagged high-value actions increased by 157% over May. Meaning our campaign is now synchronizing both strategic layers of B2H (Reach/Exposure) and B2D (Reach/Engagement).

Span.Span: Our brand is about connecting to who we are,
what we believe and the values that unify us.

P.Span: — Susan Ellis, SAS Brand Director

Our Brand campaign, Curiosity Forever, launched globally with broad emotional creative at the beginning of April 2021 (Brand to Humanity). In the middle of May we are adding Industry-focused creative that starts connecting Curiosity to Capability (Brand to Demand). Aimed at raising awareness and shifting perceptions, a Brand campaign is a longer-term marketing initiative and will make an impact over time.

With this dashboard we provide insight into campaign performance through early indicators as well as short and long-term measures. Note that we are considering this da​shboard to be dynamic and iterative, improving its functionality as we learn.​​​​​​

Span.Span: Annual brand study to assess the SAS brand health across key metrics. Two key metrics from the 2020 brand study are noted below. The next study will be available in November.

VisualElements.Graph:
false
INNOVATION PERCEPTION <StatGraph border="false" opaque="false" missingValueDisplay="autolabel"> <PadAttrs top="0px" bottom="0px" left="0px" right="0px"/> <Meta> <DynVars> <DynVar name="CATEGORY" description="CATEGORY_VAR" required="false" assignedType="character" type="character"> <DefaultValues> <Value>dd7132.bi7134</Value> </DefaultValues> </DynVar> <DynVar name="RESPONSE" description="MEASURE_VAR" required="true" assignedType="numeric" type="numeric"> <DefaultValues> <Value>dd7132.bi7135</Value> </DefaultValues> </DynVar> <DynVar name="TIP" description="TIP_VAR" required="false" assignedType="numeric" type="any" multiplesAllowed="true"> <DefaultValues> <Value>dd7132.bi7135</Value> </DefaultValues> </DynVar> <DynVar name="HIDDEN" description="HIDDEN_VAR" required="false" type="character" multiplesAllowed="true"/> </DynVars> </Meta> <LayoutRegion> <KeyValue name="KeyValue" tipListPolicy="replace" _stmt="keyValue" display="OUTLINE RESPONSEVALUE" hAlign="center" justify="left" key="responsevalue" vAlign="center" tip="TIP" category="CATEGORY" response="RESPONSE"> <KeyAttrs color="273481"/> <OutlineAttrs color="5741781"/> </KeyValue> </LayoutRegion> </StatGraph>

P.Span: The global brand study data identified Innovation Perception as key driver for being recommended for data & analytics investments.

VisualElements.Graph:
false
UNAIDED AWARENESS <StatGraph border="false" opaque="false" missingValueDisplay="autolabel"> <PadAttrs top="0px" bottom="0px" left="0px" right="0px"/> <Meta> <DynVars> <DynVar name="CATEGORY" description="CATEGORY_VAR" required="false" assignedType="character" type="character"> <DefaultValues> <Value>dd7147.bi7149</Value> </DefaultValues> </DynVar> <DynVar name="RESPONSE" description="MEASURE_VAR" required="true" assignedType="numeric" type="numeric"> <DefaultValues> <Value>dd7147.bi7150</Value> </DefaultValues> </DynVar> <DynVar name="TIP" description="TIP_VAR" required="false" assignedType="numeric" type="any" multiplesAllowed="true"> <DefaultValues> <Value>dd7147.bi7150</Value> </DefaultValues> </DynVar> <DynVar name="HIDDEN" description="HIDDEN_VAR" required="false" type="character" multiplesAllowed="true"/> </DynVars> </Meta> <LayoutRegion> <KeyValue name="KeyValue" tipListPolicy="replace" _stmt="keyValue" display="OUTLINE RESPONSEVALUE" hAlign="center" justify="left" key="responsevalue" vAlign="center" tip="TIP" category="CATEGORY" response="RESPONSE"> <KeyAttrs color="273481"/> <OutlineAttrs color="5741781"/> </KeyValue> </LayoutRegion> </StatGraph>

P.Span: Research shows that short lists are built with companies / brands that come to mind quickly. 'Unaided Awareness' tells us how much mental availability SAS occupies within our global audiences. When we increase this number, we increase our chances to make it onto shortlists.

Between June 2nd – 9th 2021 we surveyed 1,180 qualified respondents to learn how the B2H and B2D videos impact their view of SAS. Overall, the campaign is improving our Innovation perception and makes Technologists want to learn more about SAS.
After seeing the ads:
80%+ had a favorable impression of SAS
2x increase in association of SAS “providing the most innovative solutions in DMA”
80%+ of respondents said they are likely to want to learn more
Over 2/3 think “SAS is on its way up”
Staying flat no significant increase for “likelihood to consider” and “likelihood to recommend”

Span.Span: The best economic performers let go of volume metrics and have a strong​ metric preference for 'perceptual returns
wear-in of the campaign we'll start reporting the impact of the brand campaign on Marketing Influenced Pipeline.
We plan to start reporting out in the 2H 2021.

P.Span: Below are additional details on each of the Brand Dashboard KPIs as well as key contacts, links to more detailed reports and the update frequency for each KPI. Each KPI is color coded with the corresponding pillar from the brand, campaign and demand framework.
The Setting Expectations for Brand Campaign Performance slide provides additional context on these and other KPIs that will be used to measure the Curiosity Forever campaign.
